revised_title: Experimental Crystallization of Lunar Basalts: Challenges and Techniques
tldr: This study examines the challenges of experimenting on natural rocks, specifically five lunar basalts, and the problems of iron gain and loss during the experimental crystallization process. The authors discuss the techniques used to control oxygen fugacity and iron oxide content in the charges, and the effects of iron loss on the composition of the samples. The findings contribute to a better understanding of the challenges in studying natural basalts and improve experimental control in the field of lunar geology.
